item.title: Create a Dark style - TTI
item.author: invalid@example.com (Samet Chan)
item.dc:creator: Samet Chan
item.content:encoded:
It's better in my eyes and favorite so.

1. Create a style then dark style - TTI
2. Go to template > EXTRA.css
3. Add code .CSS
Code: 
body {
    color: #cecece;
    background-color: #1e1e1e !important;
}
.p-body {
    background: #1e1e1e !important;
}
.p-header {
    background: #1e1e1e !important;
}
.p-nav {
    background: #1e1e1e !important;
}
.p-sectionLinks {
    background: #828282;
    border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
.p-nav-list .p-navEl.is-selected {
    background: #828282;
}
/*...
Create a Dark style - TTI

item.title: RSS Feed
item.author: invalid@example.com (UTSA210)
item.dc:creator: UTSA210
item.content:encoded:
Hello Site Support,

Is it possible to have a RSS style feed to and back on forum posts in Curious Cosmos on the TTI website.

The rationale is TTI should be a site for learning, peer review, and maybe one day an accredited institution.

I wonder what would happen if you modeled the website like Kaplan University | Online College Courses – Campus and Online University

Thank you for your time.

God bless.

item.title: Unmoderated forum?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Given the expanded foundation we're launching in January, would you guys be interested in a "Lunatic Fringe" sort of forum where moderation doesn't take place?

Current Events and Politics forums need to be kept up with, stay on topic and adhere to all of our rules... But it'd be interesting to see the passionate debates and more extreme viewpoints that otherwise don't belong in "civilized" discussion.

This forum, while not moderated, would still need to adhere to a FEW rules:

*Nothing...

Unmoderated forum?

item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)

item.content:encoded:
Merry Christmas everyone! Looking forward to growing in 2017 in a major way! [emoji268] [emoji268] [emoji268]

item.title: Quick note about the domain
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
I had some time this afternoon to go ahead and begin the transition to the new Curious Cosmos domain. Couple things will be a little odd from now through the weekend, but we should be high and tight by the 1st

Drop me a message if you're having issues though and I'll do my best to help.

item.title: The TTI Shakeup - Details
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
As you know, I've been struggling with my interest in TTI. We've bounced around to some different platforms, tried adding or removing features, experimented with sister-sites... The whole bit. None of it worked, and our community has suffered for it. I'm not pleased with that being the end result, but it is what it is, and it's time to move forward.

In previous posts, I've said that I believe the future of TTI lies beyond the forums. That I need to pursue the site *I* want to be part of.

I...

The TTI Shakeup - Details

May "Buckazoids" be made into a cryptocurrency?

item.title: Curious Cosmos now uses SSL
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
We've had this for a while on the main page (Time Travel Institute | Tempus edax rerum), but SSL is now enabled on the forum domain as well.

This means two things:

  1. The communication between you and us is encrypted. Anything you do on the website can be seen only by you and the site, so nobody can eavesdrop on anything you transmit.

  2. It verifies the identity of the site you've connected to. When you connect to TTI using a non-secured...

Curious Cosmos now uses SSL

item.content:encoded: I happen to notice my messages count is decreasing. It was 3002 a few days ago. I also noticed a few other members are also losing total messages counts as well. Is this just a temporary glitch? Are all members being affected?

Hi there folks, Im Diego from Tec website, that one that was online between 1999-2003. Ive been out of this thing, but looking around forums this almost two decades. Im looking forward to start a new repository and upload all the devices schematics.

item.title: Please add commentary to links you post
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded: Hey guys. Links are ok here, but please type up text or a summary with the link so that it can foster further thought. After all, Time Travel Institute is a discussion forum. We also appreciate your own perspective on the link that you post. Posting links by themselves look like spam. Thank you for understanding.

item.title: A reminder to try and stay on-topic
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded:
We are trying to keep things neat and organized here at TTI, so we would be greatly appreciative if members could please pay attention to where they are posting.  Please make sure that you are not posting random thoughts all over the place and please choose a proper category.   If you are replying, either stay on topic or create a new post all together.  Random posts being placed anywhere and everywhere will most likely be deleted.  Thank you for understanding.  We do appreciate everyone's...

A reminder to try and stay on-topic

item.title: We made it!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Looks like we made it out of the conversion safe and sound!

I'll be adjusting things with the software and setting up a few store products and whatnot; please feel free to look around and get some fodder for the email blast.

item.title: Continuum
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
So, something I've wanted to do for ages is run some kind of play-by-post RPG.


There is a table-top RPG called Continuum out there which sounds ridiculously fun. Here's some of the details:

Unlike other time travel games (and fiction), which usually depict time travelers as either lone explorers or as an all-powerful "time police", Continuum assumes that time travelers (spanners) would eventually evolve their own society, with its own laws, rules,slang, groups, art...
Click to expand...
Continuum

item.title: SSL Errors
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys,


Most of you have probably noticed the site displaying an SSL error today - Something like this:




I asked our host to set up an SSL certificate on the site last night so that we could enjoy some more secure browsing, but they botched the install. The site has NOT been hacked and nobody is stealing information, it's just the SSL certificate not being installed properly.


As of now, I think I've fixed things to where attempts to visit the broken SSL...

SSL Errors

item.title: Where are you all from?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Jennifer Allan)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Allan
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm new to the forum having been recommended to check it out by a friend as I write time slip fiction (first novel out, working on sequel) I'm interested to know where you are all from and what sparked your interest in time travel.

item.title: Site Cleanup and Rearrangement
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded:
Hey Everybody!

Just an FYI. We are currently cleaning up the site, moving posts to proper threads, etc. We will also do things like remove all caps from titles and other things that are necessary to keep TTI looking sharp. We'll keep you posted on our progress!

item.title: 3/29/2016 Server Errors
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Some of you may have seen "Internal Error 500" messages tonight; this should be cleared up now.

We're new on this host, so I got them on the phone ready to start screaming, but it turns out it was part of a planned update that they sent an alert out for. We just got on this server though, so we weren't part of the email blast they sent and never got it.

I swear I didn't break anything.

Thanks for the help.

Calling Admin Support (this is not a TT topic)

item.title: Site preservation costs?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Henry Stone)
item.dc:creator: Henry Stone
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I just registered, so I'm probably about to somehow make a fool of myself. However, I like reading the stuff in here, and was thinking, how much does it even cost to preserve the site? Not the moderator work and such, just the cash upkeep you seem to be mentioning?

Of course, it seems the expected time-of-death was December 2014, which has passed, so maybe you found a solution. But just in case my unknown rich uncle dies, a figure in the ball park would be interesting...

Just a heads up!

item.title: Time limit to edit a post
item.author: invalid@example.com (Nicolas)
item.dc:creator: Nicolas
item.content:encoded:
Hey Cosmo,

I don't know you if you addressed this in one of your latest announcements, but I've noticed I can't edit some of my posts I did a while ago. Sometime I pick up on small mistakes I made and wanna correct them but now I can only edit posts made in a recent past.

I just wanted to know what is the time window for editing posts.

Thanks!

Thanks in advance all.

item.title: Support TTI!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Dizzie)
item.dc:creator: Dizzie
item.content:encoded: By the way...I'm thinking that we should all be clicking on a few ads each time we visit TTI. Couldn't hurt to pause for the cause...

item.title: Thanks to the Founders of TTI
item.author: invalid@example.com (Leslie)
item.dc:creator: Leslie
item.content:encoded:
Back in 2001 I found this place by accident. How or Why? I have no idea.
I joined. I made my first post ever on the internet. I thought it was relatively harmless, but BAM, CAZOO, HOLY CANOOOLEEEE ..... You guys ripped me a new one when I didn't even know I had an old one. DAYUM!

I didn't post anywhere for another 10 years. At Least. But HEY! Thank you. I probably would have said some stupid things that could never be erased.

Over the years I've stopped by to see what was up...

Thanks to the Founders of TTI

item.title: We're back!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone!

As many of you are likely aware, back in February Mop announced his intention to close down Time Travel Institute effective December 31st, 2014.

Now, if that weren't enough to depress a guy, a few days ago the server we were hosted on began having major problems and the site was taken offline. Over the course of a few emails with Mop, I learned that he wasn't sure what the issue was and since he didn't have the time or resources to troubleshoot, the site would likely stay...

We're back!

item.title: Server Upgrades (9/16/2014)
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hi guys,

I've just ordered an upgrade for the server, so you may see (or may have seen) the site go down for a moment or two while things were rebooted and re-provisioned.

Just a heads up

item.title: A Chat Room
item.author: invalid@example.com (Nordin Reecendo)
item.dc:creator: Nordin Reecendo
item.content:encoded: Hey, one way I feel this site could improve is if there were some sort of BBS or chat room were people could access a discussion immediately rather than post a thread and wait for responses. If the site already has a chat room and I merely don't see it, I apologize, and would appreciate a nudge in the right direction.

item.title: Search post by date
item.author: invalid@example.com (Darby)
item.dc:creator: Darby
item.content:encoded:
Cosmo,

In the XenForo search engine set-up is their a switch to enable backwards searches? The current setting only allows for forward searches starting on a prior date and looking forward, search for posts "Newer Than [date]". Most of the searching that I do are searches that start on a date and look back toward older dates - "Older Than [date]".

And is there a switch and increases the width of the date range? The current setting only allows searches back to 1-FEB-2007 while the...

Search post by date

item.title: Brief Outage
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
CloudFlare decided to put this site on my work account rather than my personal one... Not sure what that was about, but it interrupted access to the site for a few hours.

I've fixed the issue and contacted CloudFlare to ask why they're total morons.

item.title: Glitch?
item.author: invalid@example.com (titorite)
item.dc:creator: titorite
item.content:encoded:
And I think I may of found the first glitch...

So posted in this thread http://timetravelinstitute.com/threads/message-to-you-all.3993/
and then I go to hit the new posts button... The message to you all thread was ommited in the results but I did see this announcement thread had been bumped. Then I noticed the "recent posts" button in the top right so I click that button and then my post in the "message to you all" thread showed up in sequence.

Any idea why it showed up with a...

Glitch?
